fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As per [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/smart-values-993924860.html#Smartvalues-insightfieldsInsightfields], we can access an Insight field's full name, key, or summary through the following smart values:
{noformat}
{{issue.InsightField}}          // returns Some Client Name (ABC-123)
{{issue.InsightField.key}}      // returns ABC-123
{{issue.InsightField.summary}}  // returns Some Client Name
{noformat}

This, however, only works if the custom field type is *Insight object/s* but not completely working for *Insight Readonly Object/s*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with type *Insight Readonly Object/s* and another one with type *Insight object/s*.
 # Configure both so that some Insight objects will show up in both fields.
 # Configure a [manual trigger|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-general/] with Log action to test with the smart values below for both custom fields.
 #* {{issue.InsightField\}}
 #* {{issue.InsightField.summary\}}

h3. Expected Results
* With {{issue.InsightField\}}, both custom fields return value like _"This is Object A (Key-1)"_ which is both the summary and object key
 * With {{issue.InsightField.summary\}}, both custom fields return value like _"This is Object A"_ which is just the summary of the object

h3. Actual Results
* With {{issue.InsightField\}}, both custom fields return value like _"This is Object A (Key-1)"_ which is both the summary and object key
* With {{issue.InsightField.summary\}}, it returns _"This is Object A"_ for the *Insight object/s* type custom field but empty value for the *Insight Readonly Object/s*
 !image-2021-05-28-10-53-40-468.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Smart values partially working for Insight Readonly custom field

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In general, when an automation rule makes changes like issue update/delete it is visible after refreshing the page.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please makes the page refresh automatically in JIRA after an automation rule run. Can we add a re-index action in the automation rule?
h3. Workaround

Project re-indexing
fields.summary: Reload the issue when an automation rule makes changes
Ability to use JSON path expressions to query JSON data in web request responses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an outbound webhook action fails due to a timeout, the Audit logs show a different status depending if the option *Wait for response* is ticked, which can lead to some confusion about whether the rule was successful or not.


h3. Steps to replicate

- Configure an automation rule with the action *Send web request* configured with an URL that times out (for example [http://www.google.com:81|http://www.google.com:81/]):
!TestAutomationConfiguration.png|thumbnail!
- Tick the option *Wait for response*
-- Trigger this automation and wait for 30s
-- Check the audit logs, and notice that the status will show "SOME ERRORS":
!OptionTicked.png|thumbnail!
- Untick the option *Wait for response*
-- Trigger this automation and wait for 30s
-- Check the audit logs, and notice that the status will show "SUCCESS:
!OptonNotTicked.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggestion

Modify the audit logs, so that the same status is shown in case the webhook times out, and regardless if the option *Wait for response* is ticked or not
fields.summary: Modify the audit logs so that they always show the same status when an outbound webhook times out

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The 'Daily processing time' is set to 120 minutes and when the limit is reached, the rule will be throttled without any warning. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if administrators can query the current cumulative 'Daily processing time' of a specific rule before it breaches so they can manage to rule accordingly.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to query the 'Daily processing time' of a specific rule

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a rule is throttled, the rule will be disabled to prevent future executions - see [Throttle and disable|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/service-limits-993924705.html#Servicelimits-Throttleanddisable]. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Automatically restart the rule when the service limit has been increased.
fields.summary: Automatically restart rules that were throttled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating an automation rule that assigns the "Current Sprint" value to issues, the rule fails with 'Some Errors', and the audit logs show the following error message, even though the sprint can be manually assigned to the issue.
{quote}"No fields or field values to edit for issues (could be due to some field values not existing in a given project)"
{quote}
This happens because the board from which the "Active Sprint" was selected, is not the board that originated the sprint, and thus A4J cannot properly handle the configuration.
h4. Example:

In this scenario a sprint was created on the DEVP board and is currently the active sprint on it and also on Board2.
 * If the selected value is "Active Sprint (Board2)", it will trigger the error message.
 * If the selected value is "Active Sprint (DEVP board)", it will not trigger the error message.
 !Example.png!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create board 1 and board 2.
 # Create an issue on each board.
 # Create a sprint on board 1.
 # Assign both issues created on step 2 to the sprint from step 3.
 # Start the sprint.
 # Now create an automation rule that has an action to "Edit an issue", and select the Sprint Field.
 # On the Sprint field select "Active Sprint (board 2)".
 # Run the rule and check the results.

h3. Expected Results
 * The rule should add the issue onto the sprint.

h3. Actual Results
 * The rule fails to add the issue to the sprint and throws an error.
 * If the Edit Issue action has another field that is successful, the rule fails to add the issue to the sprint, but doesn't thrown an error in the audit logs. This specific behavior is handled in [JIRAAUTOSERVER-315: When there are two fields being edited on the Edit Issue action, the audit log doesn't mention the errored field if the other field is successfully updated|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JIRAAUTOSERVER-315]

h3. Workaround

To confirm which board the sprint was created on, you can use the SQL query below:

(i) When running this query, be sure to swap 'your Active Sprint name here' with actual active Sprint name (this query is case sensitive).
{code:sql}
SELECT s."NAME" AS Sprint_Name, r."NAME" AS Original_Board_Name
FROM "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" s 
JOIN "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" r ON s."RAPID_VIEW_ID" = r."ID"
WHERE s."NAME" = 'your Active Sprint name here';
{code}
With the information from the above query, adjust your rule to use *select the active sprint for the board in which it was created on* (eg. "Active Sprint (Board_where_the_sprint_was_created)", which in the above example would be 'DEVP board').
fields.summary: Adding sprint to an issue triggers "No fields or field values to edit for issues (could be due to some field values not existing in a given project)"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using a single-project rule with an Issue Fields Condition to match a Version based field, when trying to filter by any "Version" name, Automation for JIRA doesn't consider the letters that were typed on the filter.

This is specific to rules with a single project on the "Rule Scope" field of the Rule Configuration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a single-project rule;
 # Add some condition to match a Version name that exists in that filter;
 # Type to find the Version name you'd like.

Initial Version select list:
 !image-2021-05-24-15-25-15-459.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The filter considers the letters you've typed.

Desired result:
 !image-2021-05-24-15-25-39-540.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The filter doesn't recognize the values you've entered on the filter:

Current result: 
 !image-2021-05-24-15-26-24-378.png|thumbnail! 

The "Another One" version shouldn't be showing up due to the filter value that was typed.

h3. Workaround
 Add another project to the rule scope and filter it out by adding an Issue Fields Condition right after the rule trigger to match only with the Project you want, so you can use the version filter correctly.
fields.summary: When adding an issue fields condition to filter fields related to JIRA Versions the filtering doesn't work (single project rule)

fields.description:
h3. Issue

It is currently not possible to configure the timeout value for the "Send web request" action from the UI. It is set to 30 seconds by default


h3. Suggestion

Add an option to set a custom timeout value for this action from the UI.

h3. Workaround

Set the timeout value using configuration properties, as per https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/setting-configuration-properties-1026539532.html
fields.summary: Ability to override outgoing webhook timeout value from the UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This issue appears to be isolated to PostgreSQL databases due to how they determine which merge strategies to use on table joins.

A4J {{7.3}} changed the data type for {{AUDIT_ITEM_ID}} and {{ID}} in the tables {{AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM}} and {{AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE}} from {{INT}} to {{BIGINT}}.

This is causing some queries to use a {{hash join}} strategy instead of a {{merge join}}.

If the hash tables of the tables are too large to be loaded into memory, eg they are larger than 4MB but {{work_mem}} is set to the default of 4MB, Postgres begins writing them out to temporary disk files.

This causes DB Write IOPS to spike, and causes other DB queries to back up and return more slowly.

This will cause Automation Rules to be actioned more slowly.

With heavy load, it can also cause DB Connection Pool exhaustion, which in turn will cause HTTP Thread exhaustion, which will result in an outage.

This is a good read on join strategies for more information: [https://www.cybertec-postgresql.com/en/join-strategies-and-performance-in-postgresql/]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a large number of entries in the tables listed [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/upgrading-to-automation-for-jira-7-3-1055951956.html]
 # Upgrade A4J to {{7.3.x}}
 # Run this query and observe which merge strategy is in use:
{code:java}
explain analyse select
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."AUDIT_ITEM_ID",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."COMPONENT_NAME_KEY",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."COMPONENT",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."COMPONENT_ID",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."DURATION",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."ID",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."OPTIMISED_IDS",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."START_TIME",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."AUDIT_ITEM_COMPONENT_CHANGE_ID",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."AUDIT_ITEM_ID",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."CHANGE_FROM",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."CHANGE_TO",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."FIELD_NAME",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."ID",
    "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."MESSAGE"
from "public"."AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE" "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"
left join "public"."AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM" "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"
on "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."ID" = "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."AUDIT_ITEM_COMPONENT_CHANGE_ID"
where "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."AUDIT_ITEM_ID" = 10;{code}

h3. Expected Results
 * A4J is as performant as prior to the upgrade
 * Running the query above shows a {{merge join}} strategy is in use

h3. Actual Results
 * A4J is extremely non performant and causes Jira instability
 * DB Write IOPS is very high
 * Running the query above shows a {{hash join}} strategy is in use

h3. Workaround

(!) NB: Currently, downgrading to A4J {{7.2.x}} is NOT guaranteed to resolve the performance issue
  h4. *RECOMMENDED FIX*
 # Run {{ANALYZE VERBOSE}} on the tables to collect statistics about the tables, so the query planner can use these statistics to determine the most efficient execution plans for the queries.
 ## Run the query above and confirm that the join strategy is {{hash join}}
 ## Run {{ANALYZE VERBOSE "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE";}}
 ## Run {{ANALYZE VERBOSE "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM";}}
 ## Run the query above and confirm that the join strategy is now: {{merge left join}}
 ## Confirm DB Write IOPS has dropped and performance is restored

 h4. Other workarounds
 # Increase {{work_mem}} until you see Write IOPS drop and performance improve: {{SET work_mem = '16MB';}}
 ## This may need to be increased further and monitored
 ## Be careful not to increase this beyond the capacity of the memory on your database server. Bear in mind that multiple queries will run concurrently, so there may be multiple queries using memory at once, and each query can have multiple operations which consume 16mb of memory each, so the memory in use can grow exponentially.
 # Alternatively, follow the instructions in [the 7.3 release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/upgrading-to-automation-for-jira-7-3-1055951956.html] to truncate the data from your AUDITLOG tables
 ## Ideally this would be done  **prior** to the upgrade to 7.3 to avoid any performance problems, but this can be done post upgrade to immediately resolve performance issues. This can be done while the system is running, and you should see immediate recovery.
 ## This *will* result in the loss of all the audit log data
 ## Over time the audit log will fill back up and you may see a resurgence of this problem
 ## Consider [expiring audit log items|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/expire-audit-log-items-993924681.html] more frequently, so the tables are smaller
fields.summary: Upgrading A4J to 7.3.x with a large audit log on a PostgreSQL DB causes severe performance degradation in Jira

fields.description:
As a safekeeping measure, it should be possible to automatically create backups of the Automation for Jira rules. This would allow to quickly recover them in case of any issues happening with an existing rule.

Currently, the only way to backup the rules is to clicking on the  (...) button and selecting *Export rules*. This generates a single .json file with every rule from the system.
fields.summary: Automatically backup of the rules
Automation rules using the Incoming Webhook trigger fail to run if the JSON payload contains the data tag with just a string in it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Version Updated Trigger is used in the Automation for Jira rule and then

{isreleased}

smart value is used in the actions then it does not return the correct value.
 When the version is released the \{isreleased}

the smart value should hold true but this does not happen.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule with Version Updated trigger
 # Use the \{isreleased} smart value in the actions like in email
 # Release an unreleased version

h3. Expected Results

The rule is triggered and the mail is sent with \{isreleased}
 value=true
h3. Actual Results

The rule is run and the mail or the action is performed but the\{isreleased}

smart value =false which is incorrect.
h3. Workaround

Use Version Released and Version Unreleased trigger to take care of this issue
fields.summary: When using Version updated trigger than {isReleased} smart value in Actions does not hold the correct value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a pull request is created in Bitbucket, there is an automation that transitions a Jira issue to the next status.

Automation for Jira is not able to capture the user that created the pull request in Bitbucket to assign as Assignee in the Jira issue, since the status is changed by the automation between Jira and BitBucket.

!image-2021-05-07-17-17-55-036.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a DVCS Integration between Jira and BitBucket
 # Create a Pull Request in Bitbucket
 # Jira issue is transitioned to the next status by existing automation between Bitbucket and Jira.

h3. Expected Results

Automation for Jira could capture the action to manipulate the user information.
h3. Actual Results

The trigger can only be capture when the status is changed, however, it is not possible to get the User Information, as the status was changed by the automation between Jira and Bitbucket.
h3. Workaround

There is no current workaround.
fields.summary: DevOps Triggers in Automation for Jira Server/DC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After upgrading A4J to 7.3.x some customers are finding some null entries on rule actor and it seems like there are some errors about “No automation items were claimed from the queue for processing on this node since most automation rules depend on JQL indexes being available.”.  

Analysing further we've noticed that there were more than 60k results on the AO_589059_AUTOMATION_QUEUE table on JIRA startup. The majority of such entries is with a _rule_ID_ = _null_ .

This problem currently might happen regardless the database type and the size of your instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # After upgrading A4J to 7.3.0
 # Try running any rule on your environment

h3. Expected Results
The rule runs without problem.

h3. Actual Results 
More details are still being gathered.
Some errors on the logs are shown and the rule doesn't executes (or delays its execution).

{code}
2021-05-03 21:28:08,193-0500 automation-rule-executor:thread-4 ERROR anonymous     [c.c.j.p.automation.queue.JiraAutomationQueueExecutor] Unknown error processing queue item QueueItemBean{id=9277044, auditItemId=null, executionUuid=a5e97526-86b0-402b-a0f7-320ac38122e8, ruleId=null, priority=5, created=2021-05-03 08:21:45.948, claimant='automation-queue-claimer', claimTime=2021-05-03 20:26:45.459, payload='{"tenantContext":{"clientKey":"com.codebarrel.tenant.global","environment":"prod","tenantId":{"id":"00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000bbbbbb"}},"event":{"clientKey":"com.codebarrel.tenant.global","triggerType":"EVENT","type":"jira:issue_created:issue_...'}:
java.lang.RuntimeException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor.executeAsWithResult(JiraThreadLocalExecutor.java:70)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor.executeAsWithResult(JiraThreadLocalExecutor.java:53)
	at com.codebarrel.jira.plugin.automation.queue.JiraAutomationQueueExecutor.lambda$processClaimedItem$4(JiraAutomationQueueExecutor.java:252)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.concurrent.BoundedExecutor$1.run(BoundedExecutor.java:50)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.SearchUnavailableException
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getEntitySearcher(DefaultIndexManager.java:927)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.index.DefaultIndexManager.getIssueSearcher(DefaultIndexManager.java:906)
	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor972.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
{code}

{code}
2021-05-04 08:01:30,959-0500 https-jsse-nio-4343-exec-22 ERROR jra_adm 463x29149x3 1oaf9f9 162.202.158.61 /servicedesk/customer/portal/2/create/74 [c.c.j.p.a.service.execution.JiraThreadLocalExecutor] Unexpected error in thread local executor with actorKey 'jra_adm'.
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught PSQLException for select "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."AUDIT_ITEM_ID", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."COMPONENT_NAME_KEY", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."COMPONENT", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."COMPONENT_ID", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."DURATION", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."ID", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."OPTIMISED_IDS", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."START_TIME", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."AUDIT_ITEM_COMPONENT_CHANGE_ID", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."AUDIT_ITEM_ID", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."CHANGE_FROM", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."CHANGE_TO", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."FIELD_NAME", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."ID", "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."MESSAGE"
from "public"."AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE" "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"
left join "public"."AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM" "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"
on "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."ID" = "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_CGE_ITEM"."AUDIT_ITEM_COMPONENT_CHANGE_ID"
where "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."AUDIT_ITEM_ID" = ?
order by "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."START_TIME" asc, "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM_COMP_CGE"."ID" asc
	at com.querydsl.sql.DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.translate(DefaultSQLExceptionTranslator.java:50)
	at com.querydsl.sql.Configuration.translate(Configuration.java:459)
{code}

It might also get some problems on thread waiting for the database to response:

 !image-2021-05-07-15-56-05-944.png|thumbnail! 

Running the queries below might help on troubleshooting this case:

{code}
// Count how many items we have waiting to be processed
SELECT count(*) FROM "AO_589059_AUTOMATION_QUEUE";

//Shows which rules have events waiting to processed
SELECT "RULE_ID", count(*) FROM "AO_589059_AUTOMATION_QUEUE" GROUP BY "RULE_ID" order by count desc;

// Shows how many rule ran per hour in last 2 weeks. Including total & avg duration during that hour
SELECT date_trunc('hour', "CREATED") AS rule_ran_hour, count(*), sum("DURATION"), avg("DURATION")
FROM "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM"
WHERE "CREATED" > (now() - interval '2 week')
GROUP BY rule_ran_hour
ORDER BY rule_ran_hour;

// shows top 50 rules ordered by how much time they were in the queue in total in the last 2 weeks
SELECT ai."OBJECT_ITEM_ID" as rule_id, rc."NAME" as rule_name, count(*),
  avg("DURATION")              AS time_avg_ms,
  avg("END_TIME" - "START_TIME") AS queued_time_avg
FROM "AO_589059_AUDIT_ITEM" ai JOIN "AO_589059_RULE_CONFIG" rc ON "OBJECT_ITEM_ID" = rc."ID" 
WHERE ai."CREATED" > (now() - INTERVAL '2 week')
GROUP BY "OBJECT_ITEM_ID", rc."NAME"
ORDER BY queued_time_avg DESC
LIMIT 50;
{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: After upgrading A4J to 7.3.x the majority of my rules stopped working

fields.summary: Ability to copy components when creating/updating a rule

fields.description:
*Synopsis*

As a Jira administrator, I would like the ability to search the audit logs of my organisation's automation rules.

This would enable me to identify what automation rule triggered the change(s) on a specific Jira ticket. 

For example, I create ticket {{TEST-12345}}. An automation rule updates said ticket between creation and the next time I look at it. 

I would like the ability to search for {{TEST-12345.}}

 

*Current functionality*

At this time, to search which rule updated a ticket, a user must scroll through potentially hundreds of pages (depending on how many rules have executed since the ticket was changed).

 

*Proposal*

A search box added on the page with the ability to search by:
 * ticket reference (e.g. {{TEST-12345}})
 * multiple ticket references, comma-separated
 * a 'time picker' to search for all executions before, after, or inbetween dates and times

 

*Alternative*

Another, more lightweight suggestion would be to add another column to the audit log view which simply lists which ticket(s) were affected by the rule execution, making 'control-f' feasible
fields.summary: Ability to search audit logs of Automation rules

fields.description:
As a Jira Admin, I'd like some automation rules to stop the current execution should an error occur in a validation or action.

Currently, the rule continues to execute until the very end even if errors happened during the way, which may lead to unexpected results.

h4.Example
{panel}
# Scheduled execution based in a JQL
# Transition issues
# Assign issues
# Leave a comment

If the transition fails (step 2), the issue(s) will still be edited (step 3) and commented (step 4).
We want an option in the automation rule to prevent further execution should an error occur.
{panel}
fields.summary: Stop the execution of an automation rule should an error occur

fields.description:
Hello :) 

I have been searching through documentation but haven't been able to find anything on the topic but 1 feature that would be great is error handling.

We have a lot of rules and so some occasionally fail but there is not easy way to introduce a forced continue as far as I can see. There are some workarounds with conditions and smart values but difficult to cover 100% of cases.

If there is already an optimal way to do this please let me know :)
fields.summary: Error Handling

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The "If issue type" conditions (and probably others, but this is the one I use most) end up with the wrong issue types when moving between environments whose IDs don't match. This is going to be common when creating new issue types in a test environment before going live in Production, and the identification should be more robust, checking that the name of the issue type (or other field) matches what was exported upon import, and finding a match if the ID and name don't both match, perhaps even asking for what that ID/name should map to in the new environment. Customer had to update every rule individually to correct this after my last import.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Refresh Dev environment from Prod so they match 100%
2. Create two new issue types
3. Create an automation rule with a condition that requires one of those two new issue types in Dev
4. Export the rule from Dev
5. Create the two new issue types in Prod, possibly in a different order (because of using Project Configurator to move the issue types between environments)
6. Import the rule from the file

h3. Expected Results
No matter what order the issue types are created in, the rule is correct, or alerts the user running the import that the issue types in the target environment (Prod) don't match what was exported from Dev

h3. Actual Results
The rule may silently refer to the WRONG issue type without any indication of what happened unless you're looking for it.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Migrating rules from two different instances might cause some inconsistency problems

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation is ignoring the {{Issue Created}} trigger, not firing the rules when it should.
 * This is the rule tested:
 !image-2021-04-15-10-23-53-932.png|width=176,height=204!
 * Below is the audit log:
 !image-2021-04-15-10-24-34-870.png|width=364,height=121!
 * The issue created:
 !image-2021-04-15-10-26-14-262.png|width=364,height=121!
 * The project's workflow:
 !image-2021-04-15-10-26-50-479.png|width=178,height=146!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new rule with a single project scope.
 # Set the Trigger to {{*Issue Created*}}.
 # Set any action such as {{*Edit Issue*}} or {{*Send email*}}.
 # Create a new issue.

h3. Expected Results

When an issue is created, the rule is triggered and performs the actions set.
h3. Actual Results

The rule is not triggered, therefore, no actions are performed.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue Created Trigger ignored

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation is sending e-mails ignoring the results of the JQL in the trigger.
When no results are returned, Automation sends an e-mail with blank values.
The Audit Log shows the *No Actions Performed* status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new rule.
# Set the trigger to *Scheduled*.
## Use the following CRON expression: *0 0 9,19 ? * MON-FRI*.
## Set the option {{When rule executes...}} to *run a JQL search and pass results to subsequent conditions and actions*.
## Add any JQL that would return no results.
# Add the action *Send Email*.
# Use the {{issue.key}} smart value on the *Subject*.
# Use the following smart values on the *Content*:
## {{reporter.displayName}}
## {{issue.key}}
## {{issue.summary}}
## {{assignee.displayName}}


h3. Expected Results

Since no issues were returned by the JQL, no e-mail is going to be fired.

h3. Actual Results

Automation is firing e-mails even though there were no issues returned by the JQL.
The Audit Log shows the *No Actions Performed* status.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation ignoring trigger

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

It would be nice to be able to set the initiator or other user fields on the issue (reporter, assignee) as the actor of the rule.
Things to watch for:
 * Permission escalation

 * Need a fallback for scheduled rules / incoming web hook

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be good if we could use smart values to set the rule actor in the server also.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: Allow user who triggered event to be rule Actor

fields.description:
Currently, the Automation for Jira Action: Add service Management Customer supports
 * Email address
 * username
 * Organization
 * !image-2021-04-14-14-30-52-170.png|width=302,height=164!

But it lacks the capability to set the below options which is available in default user creation

!2021-04-09_06h59_49.png!

like the option to add
 * Directory
 * Password

It would be great if these options are also added in the action so that directory and password can also be added using this action.
fields.summary: Add options to set password and also allow crowd or Directories to be configured while using "Add Service Management Customer" Action

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

When creating an Automation and trying to set the Action *Create Sub-tasks* the below error message appears (even if the Project has the *Sub-task* issue type):
 !Screen Shot 2021-04-09 at 17.18.46.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Example:
 - User creating automation and doesn't have *Create issue* project permission on the affected project

h2. Suggested Solution

Change the Message to something more specific, like:

"The User XXXX which is trying to create this rule, doesn't have the XXXXX Project permission"
fields.summary: Improve Automation's "Create sub-tasks" error message

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attempting to delete Sub-tasks results in errors and an incorrect search index.

The effect is inconsistent. If there is only one sub-task it will be deleted fairly reliably. 
 Sometimes one or more subtask in a group will be deleted. When there are ~30 subtasks it fails to delete any subtasks consistently.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add 5+ subtasks to an issue.
# Create a rule with a manual trigger and a "For Sub-tasks" branch rule.
# In the branch rule, add the "Delete Issue" action.
# Trigger the rule from the More menu

h3. Expected Results
* All sub-tasks deleted and no longer visible on the parent issue.
* Searching for parent=PARENT_ISSUE_KEY returns no results.

h3. Actual Results

* Sub-tasks are not deleted and are still visible in the parent issue.
* Searching for parent=PARENT_ISSUE_KEY returns no results.

If I modify the Summary of one of the sub-tasks (which reindexes it) this sub-task will re-appear in search results.

In the instance where this was observed, SQL exceptions appear in the audit log for the rule.
{code}
Caught PSQLException for update public.issuelink set sequence = ? where issuelink.id = ?
{code}
or
{code}
org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT, ARCHIVED, ARCHIVEDBY, ARCHIVEDDATE FROM public.jiraissue WHERE ID=? (ERROR: current transaction is aborted, commands ignored until end of transaction block)...
{code}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using the "Delete Issue" action with "For Sub-tasks" branch rule fails to delete the Sub-tasks

fields.description: As a Jira admin, I'd like to manipulate and convert the responses from webhooks (webhookResponse.body) to a CSV format.
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I'd like to manipulate and convert the responses from webhooks to a CSV format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the *Send email* action with the \{{author.avatarUrls}} smart value, custom profile avatars are not displayed on the e-mail body.
 The same does not happen if the user is set with a "default" avatar.
 * This is the result, using a default avatar image:
 !default_avatar.png! 
 !default_mail.png|width=322,height=119!
 * This is the result, using a custom avatar image:
 !custom_avatar.png! 
 !custom_mail.png|width=322,height=119! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
 # Create an automation rule.
 # Add the *Send email* action.
 # Use the \{{author.avatarUrls}} on the e-mail body.
 ## Test using a custom avatar image.
 ## Test using a default avatar image. (From the list provided by Jira)

h3. Expected Results

All avatar images are displayed on the e-mail body.
h3. Actual Results

Only default avatar images are displayed on the e-mail body.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom avatars not displayed for send email action

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is no option to change a *sub-task* parent issue using automation. Also, it is not possible to move issues using automation rules (which could be a workaround for the first problem).

h2. Suggested Solution

Add *Change Parent issue* or *Move issue* as an action rule to enable this option.

h2. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Action to change sub-task parent (or move a sub-task for one project to another)

fields.description:
When creating new issues in a project using automation, a great option to have would be to set the 'Reporter' as the Project Lead.

 

At the moment we are having to bulk change the reporter after the issue have been created by 'Automation for Jira' user.

 

Cheers

 

Phil
fields.summary: Reporter set to Project Lead

fields.description:
As a Jira admin, I'd like to be able to execute some operations with the "Issue Picker" (com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner:single-issue-picker-cf) field from ScriptRunner.

For example: I want to clone a ticket and keep the value from the "Issue Picker" on the new cloned ticket but the value is never copied.
fields.summary: Add support to "Issue Picker" field from ScriptRunner

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The Automation admin screen breaks when there are over 2100 Automation Rules and the database in use is MS SQL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure Jira to connect to MS SQL database
 # Create over 2100 automation rules
 # Access the Automation admin screen to list the automations

h3. Expected Results
The admin screen will render and list all Automation Rules.

h3. Actual Results
The screen breaks with a template rendering exception and the MS SQL 2100 parameter limit error on the logs.

The screen may exhibit errors such as:
{code}com.google.template.soy.tofu.SoyTofuException: In 'print' tag, expression "$localeString" evaluates to undefined.{code}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Normally, any automation rule should always check the permissions from the *Rule actor* (defined in the rule configuration) to execute any action.

However, this is not the case when an action is trying to fetch linked issues. In this specific scenario, the permissions of the person who initiated the automation rule (=initiator) are used instead of the rule actor permissions.

This issue might result in actions which are not executed correctly.

h3. Steps to replicate

- Create 2 projects. For example:
-- Project SCRUMSAMPL
-- Project TESTSD
- Create 2 users with the following permissions:
-- User 1 has *browse projects* permission in both projects
-- User 2 has *browse projects* permission only in project SCRUMSAMPL, but not in TESTSD
- Create an issue in each project
- Link both issues together
 !Bug_Step2.png|thumbnail! 
- Create an automation rule that automatically creates a new ticket, and that copies the linked issues from the trigger issue into the newly created issue. Make sure to set the rule actor as *User 1* (the user who has *browse projects* permission in both projects)
 !Bug_Step1.png|thumbnail! 
- Trigger the automation by making an update to the ticket from the project SCRUMPSAMPL, and by using the User 2 as the "initiator"

h3. Expected Results

The newly created ticket include the linked issue (which is an issue from the project TESTSD) from the trigger issue into the newly created issue, since:
- the rule actor permissions should be checked
- the rule actor is set to User 1 who has permission to view issues from TESTSD

 !Bug_Step3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The newly created ticket does not contain a link to the ticket from the TESTSD project.
That's because the rule initiator (User 2) does not have permission to view this ticket

 !Bug_Step4.png|thumbnail! 

Looking into the audit logs, we can also see that if the rule is initiated by the user 2, the linked issue is not seen and therefore not copied:

 !Bug_Step5.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Ensure that the initiator of the rule has browse project permissions in all the projects
fields.summary: The wrong permissions are checked when an automation rule tries to fetch linked issues

fields.description:
Basically, if you allow Project Administrators to manage automation rules, they have the ability to impersonate every user in a Jira environment. 

This feature can be used to "impersonate" every single user in a Jira environment, and it may be used to complete tasks that were not considered when this feature was developed.

Therefore, it would be wise to consider a method of limiting this ability, allowing project administrators to only select users from a subset of the entire environment's user base.
fields.summary: Limit the ability of Project Administrators to select users as Role Actors

fields.description:
h2. User story suggestion

As an automation rule writer

I want a warning error message logged when the issue processing limit (100) is exceeded

So I have visibility that some issues were not processed by the automation rule
h2. Acceptance criteria
 * When a trigger gathers more than 100 issues, log the limit was exceeded and continue processing with the first 100 issues
 * When a branch gathers more than 100 issues, log the limit was exceeded and continue processing with the first 100 issues
 * Bonus: rule detail has a setting to halt the rule when more than 100 issues are encountered for processing.  The default for this setting is disabled, preserving prior behavior.

h2. Business case

As more customers rely upon automation rules, knowing which issues processed (or did not) is a key to success. Today, rules only process the first 100 issues gathered and there is limited visibility when the limit is exceeded.  For JQL which can be resolved during development, this can be tested with Validate Query.  However this validation is only confirmed at a point in time and does not help later.  For branches of related issues, there is no such validation; thus exceeding the limit for links or sub-tasks is not visible.
fields.summary: log warning error when over issue processing limit exceeded
Document smart value syntax for Webhooks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, Automation allows for Versions creation, release, and unrelease. It would be great if *Edit*, *Archive* and *Delete* would also be included as valid operations.

h3. Workaround

The only workaround right now is to manually perform the actions.
fields.summary: Include the other Version-related operations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation for Jira does not detect more than 50 values for any fields in Jira. 
For example: When we have 50+ versions (Projects > Releases), *Fix Version/s* field in the *Issue fields condition* does not show all the options in the “value” dropdown. The dropdown shows 51 versions.

As per the design, A4J requests Jira REST API to get project versions with default settings. And these 50 records are the maximum number that Jira returns by default. 

Due to this, if any fields in Jira have more than 50 values, A4J will display only the first 50 values of them. There are options for pagination and result size, but A4J doesn't use them. 

This is a limitation when customers have fields with 100+ values. For example, in a big sized project, there could be 100+ Versions and A4J will fetch only 50 versions. This would cause an impact as other versions could not be used for automation purposes.

Dropdown does not list the 'matching' options as per the input. We need to scroll to select the required version irrespective of the input entered.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSW project. Go to Projects > Releases. Create 50+ (minimum 50) versions.
 # Create a simple A4J rule to fetch those versions and set them in the "Fix Version/s" field.
 !Screenshot 2021-03-11 at 5.35.35 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2021-03-11 at 5.36.02 PM.png|thumbnail!  !Screenshot 2021-03-11 at 5.36.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
All Versions should be displayed in the dropdown. Also dropdown should list the 'matching' versions as per the input entered.
 
h3. Actual Results
A4J displays only 50 versions. The versions entered after 50th are omitted. 
(i) Dropdown does not list the versions 'matching' the input characters. It just lists the versions irrespective of the input and we need to scroll manually to find the required version. This would be exhaustive when there are 100+ versions in the dropdown.
fields.summary: A4J lists only first 50 values for Jira fields (dropdown) in components

fields.description:
h2. Problem Definition

The audit log may not display useful information for the user's and/or troubleshooting cases sometimes.
h3. Example:
 - You have a rule that is going to affect 100 plus issues.
 - Upon running the rule, it returns with *Some Errors*.
 - When checking the audit log, you'll be presented with messages such as:
 -- "_Error updating field customfield_xxxx: Error! Response from server: 'Not Found'_"
 - It is not possible to determine which of the 100 plus issues were affected by the error.

h2. Suggested Solution

It would be a great improvement if the error messages could include the issue(s) they are referring to.
h2. Workaround

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Improve Automation's audit log

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when using the Xporter action on Automation for Jira, it is not possible to use smart values on the e-mail body or the file's name.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
It would be interesting to be able to use smart values for both.

h3. Workaround 

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Use smart values with Xporter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Whenever you edit rule labels, the changes do not stick.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule label, let's call it *First Test*.
 # Click on the dropdown menu and select *Edit*.
 # Alter the label's name to *First Test - Second Test* and its background color.
 # Press the *Done* button.

h3. Expected Results
* The label's name and the background color will be updated.

h3. Actual Results
* The label's name and its background color remain the same.

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-05 at 14.42.51.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing rule labels does not alter them

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trigger of A4J rule is executed twice or more within seconds, a 'race condition' is created in "automation queue" causing abnormal behaviour in the validation part of the rule for the second execution. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 *  Create a simple A4J rule and workflow where issue is transitioned to "Waiting for Customer" when agent comments and "Customer Updated" when comment is made by the customer.
 ** Create a new issue and transition it to 'Waiting for Customer'. From the customer portal, add 2 comments within seconds. This should transition the issue to "Customer Updated".
 ** For Comment 1, In the audit logs, we could see the rule was successful and issue was transitioned to "Customer Updated".
 ** For Comment 2, in the audit logs, we could see the rule failed with *No transitions to specified status could be found for issues (with current status)* error.
 !Screenshot 2021-02-26 at 12.11.51 PM (1).png|thumbnail!
 ** If we notice the *History* tab for the issue, where the rule was executed, we see for Comment 1 at 12:02 PM, which is 26/02/21 12:02:08 pm in A4J audit log, the rule is 'successful'.
 ** However, for Comment 2 at 12:02 PM, which is 26/02/21 12:02:12 pm in A4J audit log, the rule failed with 'Some Errors'.
 !Screenshot 2021-02-26 at 12.14.03 PM (1).png|thumbnail! 
 * This could have happened - The customer makes 2 comments and triggers the A4J rule twice within seconds.
 ** *Iteration 1* -
 ### Comment 1 matched all 'if' conditions successfully
 ### Comment 1 transitioned the issue to 'Customer Updated'.
 ** *Iteration 2* - At the same instant, Comment 2 is also triggered, this has reached the 'if' condition even before or while "Step 2" of *Iteration 1* is underway. Due to this, the "If" condition is passed successfully. Next, when the rule moves to the 'Transition' part, it fails as the issue is not in *With Customer* status anymore.
 * This could be the reason why we see the rule failing with "Some errors" in audit logs. This would happen only when the customer adds one or more comments within seconds when the execution of the rule is still underway for the first comment.

h3. Expected Results
'If' condition should 'fail' when A4J rule is triggered in second customer comment as the first comment would have transitioned issue to 'Customer Updated'.

h3. Actual Results
'If' condition is successful and A4J execution moves to 'Transition' part where rule fails and throws error message in audit logs.

As A4J rule execution and Jira events are asynchronous we are getting into these 'race conditions' where rule is failing under certain scenarios. It would be great if A4J rule execution and related Jira events are made synchronous.
fields.summary: Rule triggered twice within seconds causes possible "race condition" resulting in validation ('if' component) to behave wrongly.

fields.description:
Certain rules that have several components can be difficult to maintain and alter as required through the user interface.

It would be great if there was a way to programmatically alter these rules through the user interface, allowing administrators to easily maintain them.
fields.summary: Allow rules to be programmatically edited

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to create, edit, delete, enable or disable automation rules using a REST API.

In some cases, for example when creating a new staging instance from production data, it is desired to have some or all automation rules disabled or edited at once, in an automated way.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement a public REST API to allow the following operations:
* Create rules
* Edit rules
* Enable/disable rules
* Delete rules
* Copy rules
* Import/export rules

h3. Other
There's already an open suggestion in Code Barrel's old Jira instance: https://codebarrel.atlassian.net/browse/AUT-999
fields.summary: Official REST API to manage rules

fields.description:
A use case:

Customer would like to be able to update Jira fields (for example worklog) by sending an email that will contain the fields data.

It will be great if A4J is able to parse and extract the field data from a body of an email or a comment and update the fields accordingly

An extended functionality would be to extract the same values even from any comments added (for example, via REST API)
fields.summary: Ability to extract fields from email and or comments for storage in issue fields

fields.description: It would be great to have an issue watcher user condition, to be able to trigger automation for example if a watcher commented on a ticket
fields.summary: Issue Watcher user condition
Work Log does not get copied for 'Linked' issues after 20 entries in Automation for Jira

fields.description: When using multiple triggers. It would be a great development, if we could use a 'If <trigger name>' - else -conditions to our automations.
fields.summary: Conditions for Multiple triggers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When {{now.weekOfYear}} is used in A4J rules, it returns the wrong week number
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule to create a ticket in a project
 # In the *Create issue* event, include {{now.weekOfYear}} in the summary
 # Execute the rule and check the week number in the issue summary

h3. Expected Results

{{now.weekOfYear}} should return the correct week number
h3. Actual Results

{{now.weekOfYear}} returns the wrong week number
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Example:
 In the screenshots attached, the log-action shows week 9 but we are in week 8 (Feb 22 - Feb 28) of 2021

fields.description: On selecting the "delete attachment"  we don't have an option to select the file based on the size. Having this will help in deleting the unwanted files or signatures or logos.
fields.summary: Add size/dimension criteria for Delete attachment

fields.description:
Some customers would like to change the automation number formats (from number fields).

e.g: 15,000 (which without format would be: 15000.0)

There is a way to do this on Cloud, using the below format:

* {{issue.A Number Field.format("##.#")}}

(i) It doesn't work on Server when trying to create an automation to send emails
fields.summary: Provide support for number formatting in smart-values (decimal places etc)
Show hidden Request Types in Issue fields conditions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* We have an A4J rule with a "Work Logged" trigger (All working operations) which is project-specific. Rule works fine when work is logged.
* If we delete any of the issue containing 'logged work' (previously entered multiple work logs), then 2 events would be triggered through Jira - 
** Jira starts deleting the issue along with logged work (Work log) in it.
** As part of issue deletion, when the work logged is deleted, it triggers the A4J rule as the rule is configured as *"Work Logged" trigger (All working operations)*. 
(i) This Jira deletion and A4J execution process are asynchronous (independent of each other). 
** The A4J rule during its execution will look for *projectID* and other details of the issue to enter them into the 'audit logs' of the rule. By then, if Jira has already deleted the issue (as both processes are independent), A4J will not get the projectID and would assume the rule to be 'Global' and would make the audit log 'global'. As the audit log becomes global, it would not be visible from project settings.
** Another side effect is that if any notifications are configured, the user would get the failure notifications for this rule. As the rule is project-specific, and the audit log for the failure is made 'global'; the non-Jira admin user would not be able to view the audit logs. 
** If there are multiple entries under 'Work log' for the deleted issue, the A4J rule would be triggered multiple times thereby sending multiple 'failure' notifications for the user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an A4J rule with "Work Logged" trigger (All working operations).
 # Enter multiple 'work log' hours.
 # Delete the issue.
The occurrence is random. At times the rule is 'SUCCESS' with expected results. Sometimes it fails with 'SOME ERRORS'. When rule fails with 'SOME ERRORS', it stays project-specific or sometimes becomes 'Global'.

h3. Expected Results
The rule should not be triggered when the issue is deleted. Even if the rule is triggered, it should not trigger multiple tiles and audit logs should be visible from Project Settings. Audit logs should not be 'Global'.

h3. Actual Results
Results vary with every execution - 
* Rule is 'SUCCESS' with audit log showing an error message. The audit log for the execution is visible when accessed through Project Settings.
* Rule fails with 'SOME ERRORS' with audit log showing an error message. The audit log for the execution is visible when accessed through Project Settings.
* Rule fails with 'SOME ERRORS' with audit log showing an error message. The audit log for the execution is *not visible* when accessed through Project Settings. The audit log is marked 'Global' and is only visible when accessed Globally.
* Rule is triggered multiple times (for every deleted 'Work log' entry of a single issue).
{panel}
h4. Trial 1
Here the deleted issue, '12103' (ATJ-12103) had 2 entries for work log. Hence when the issue was deleted, A4J rule was triggered twice. both the times, the rule execution marked the audit log as project-specific.
   !Screenshot 2021-02-12 at 12.29.30 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Trial 2
Here the deleted issue, '12104' (ATJ-12104) had 3 entries for work log. Hence when the issue was deleted, A4J rule was triggered thrice. 2 of the rule execution marked the audit log as project-specific and 3rd one made the audit log as 'Global'.
!Screenshot 2021-02-12 at 12.30.08 PM.png|thumbnail!{panel}

h3. Workaround
* Change the "*Work Logged*" trigger in A4J from "*All working operations*" to just "*Created*" and "*Updated*". This would trigger the A4J rule when available the work log is either added or edited. Be Deleting the issue would not trigger the A4J rule.
* If changing the "*Work Logged*" trigger in A4J from "*All working operations*" is not an option, then be cautious while deleting the issue as deleting the issue could trigger this behavior.
fields.summary: Deleting an Issue is causing the unnecessary trigger of "Work Logged" and making audit log 'Global'

fields.description:
As an admin I would like to have the possibility to set up an automation for a *project category*. 
We have different categories of software projects. At the moment we have effort to enter a new project into every automation. 
It is not possible to configure an automation for a specific project category. 

Please add this feature.

The effort to configure a new project will decrease. 
Errors will be avoided.
fields.summary: Ability to run an automation for a project category

fields.description:
Currently, we have some different ways of controlling the URLs that A4J can send and receive webhooks.

This might cause some problems in maintaining or adjusting A4J code when some patterns are changed. Eg. Microsoft Teams changed the pattern on their side and we need to change that too.

We could easily avoid this kind of issues if we leave our URL security to JIRA allow list which is a feature used for a long time until now.
fields.summary: Automation for JIRA should use JIRA allowlist to external URLs

fields.description:
Currently Automation for Jira Server does not support sum function in Smart Values.

Use case: Customer would like to be able to sum up automatically all time spent on all child issues in an epic.

While it's possible in [Automation for Jira Cloud|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Automation-articles/How-to-sum-up-logged-hours-using-automation-in-Jira-Cloud/ba-p/1409115], it's not possible in Jira Server yet

Workaround:
1) Use a 3rd party add-on such that adds calculated custom field or scripting functionality
2) Migrate to Jira Cloud
fields.summary: Add support for sum function in smart values

 * Sum the story points in an epic and populate the Story Points field with that value
 * Sum the story points for issue types above the epic
 * Add up any numeric field across projects and hierarchies,

 ** Example: Show the total cost of an initiative, that includes issues in multiple projects, using a blended rate * hours logged

fields.description:
h3.Problem Statement
Automation for Jira allows the "Create Issue" action to accept Smart Values in the Project and Issue Type fields, but it only works with the entities Ids, not names.

h3.How to reproduce
# Create a text field (single line) custom field "My Text Field" and add it to an issue type's screens
# Make an automation rule that, upon a comment, for example, creates a new issue on project Project {{issue.My Text Field}}
# Edit an issue and set "My Text Field" to match a project's Key
# Comment the issue

h3.Expected result
A new issue would be created by the automation on the project which the Key was present on the "My Text Field"

h3.Actual results
Automation rule fails because it only accepts project Ids, not Keys nor names.

h3.Workaround
Instead of entering the project Key in "My Text Field", enter the project's Id. The automation will work.
The exact same thing goes for the Issue Type field in the Create Issue automation action.
{panel}
fields.summary: Improve Automation Rules so they accept keys and names for the Project and Issue Type fields instead of just the Ids

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some of the Exported Automation rules from Cloud fails to be imported to Server/DC

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export multiple rules from Cloud
 # Attempt to import them in Automation for Jira Server/DC.

h3. Expected Results

The rules are imported without issues.
h3. Actual Results

The import succeeds and the following error is displayed:

"Some of the rules were not parsed successfully and can not be imported"

The format of the export from Cloud rules export is as below but the server does not support *type=NAME* 
{noformat}
"field":{ "type": "NAME", "value": "Access Group in APC" },
{noformat}
This causes the import process to ignore some rules and proceed with the valid ones.
 . !image-2021-01-29-19-31-09-279.png|width=476,height=255!

The following errors might be found in the Jira logs, after enabling the debugging package {{com.codebarrel}}:
- Error 1:
{code}
com.codebarrel.api.JsonSupport$JsonDeserializationException: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.UnrecognizedPropertyException: Unrecognized field "field" (class com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.common.FieldOperation), not marked as ignorable (4 known properties: "value", "type", "fieldType", "fieldId"])
 at [Source: (ByteArrayInputStream); line: 1, column: 26] (through reference chain: com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.common.IssueActionConfig["operations"]->java.util.ArrayList[0]->com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.common.FieldOperation["field"])
	at com.codebarrel.api.JsonSupport.toObject(JsonSupport.java:107)
{code}
- Error 2:
{code}
com.codebarrel.api.JsonSupport$JsonDeserializationException: com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.exc.InvalidFormatException: Cannot deserialize value of type `com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.trigger.fieldchanged.config.FieldChangedConfig$Type` from String "fieldName": value not one of declared Enum instance names: [field, match]
 at [Source: (ByteArrayInputStream); line: 1, column: 41] (through reference chain: com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.trigger.fieldchanged.config.MultiFieldChangedTriggerConfig["fields"]->java.util.ArrayList[0]->com.codebarrel.automation.rulecomponent.jira.trigger.fieldchanged.config.FieldChangedConfig["type"])
	at com.codebarrel.api.JsonSupport.toObject(JsonSupport.java:107)
{code}


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When configuring and following the steps required to configure MS Teams and Automation for JIRA to work together, the message below appears: 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Microsoft Teams, choose More options (…) next to the channel name and choose Connectors.
 # From the list of connectors, create an incoming webhook
 # Copy the webhook URL and paste the URL in the Send Microsoft Teams message action.

h3. Expected Results
A4J recognizes the pattern as valid.

h3. Actual Results
A4J is waiting for outlook.office.com/webhook pattern of URL on MS Teams action.


h3. Workaround
- Upgrade to 7.2.6;
- Run a cUrl command as below:

{code}
curl -u admin:admin -X PUT -H 'Content-type: application/json'  --data '{"key":"ms.teams.notification.action.url.prefix","value":"https://"}' http://<your-URL.COM>/rest/cb-automation/1/configuration/property/
{code}

This will set the prefix to "https://" and allow you to add different MS Teams url patterns.

fields.description:
h3. Description

Automation rules configured with the trigger *SLA threshold breached* may not be triggered if the SLA of a Service Desk requests stops exactly at end of a working day.


h3. Steps to re-produce

- Create a Service Desk project
- Configure an SLA in *Project Settings > SLAs* with goals associated to the default 9-5 calendar (= 9:00-17:00). You can use the default *Time to resolution* SLA to replicate the bug:
 !SLA_Config.png|thumbnail! 
 !Calendar_Config.png|thumbnail! 
- Create an automation rule with:
-- Trigger: *SLA threshold breached*, with the *Breached* option selected
-- Action: any action of your choice
 !AutomationRule_notworking.png|thumbnail! 
- Create an issue just before 9:00am
-- The SLA will be paused and start ticking at 9:00am due to the 9-5 calendar
- Now wait until 17:00: the SLA will be paused (due to the 9-5 calendar)
- Wait until the next day at 9:00: the SLA will resume and will be immediately breached

h3. Actual results

The automation rule is not triggered

h3. Expected results

The automation rule should be triggered since the SLA has breached.

h3. Workaround

Edit the Automation rule trigger by selecting *Breached by more than 5 minutes* instead of *Breached*
 !AutomationRule_workaround.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SLA breached rules may not trigger if SLA stops exactly at end of a working day

fields.description:
Currently, in the "Send email" action, A4J  adds all the mentioned mail recipients to a single mail. If the mail recipients contain one or more 'invalid' email addresses, delivery to all email recipients fails on some SMTP mail servers.

* When Jira needs to send a notification to multiple users, Jira will build 1 email per user, and put this user in the “To:” header of that email, and sends the mail. This will ensure that emails are sent individually and any 'invalid' email address does not affect 'valid' email addresses.
* However, when the A4J action  “Send email” needs to send an email to multiple users, this action only builds 1 single email and adds all the users into the “To:” header. This could cause issues with some SMTP mail servers, if 1 single email address is invalid, the whole email is not sent, thereby affecting 'valid' users.

It would be great if A4J  feature uses the behaviour of Jira and send separate emails for different mail addresses so that mail to all 'valid' addresses are sent even if the recipient list contains one or more 'invalid' email addresses.
fields.summary: Send mails individually from Recipients list in "Send email" action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Under some conditions, the *Create issue* action and *Edit issue* actions fail to be executed when adding the users from a *multi user picker* field into another one.

h3. Environment

This issue is replicable on Jira 8.4 and any higher version, where user keys have been changed to JIRAUSERXXXX, per [GDPR changes in Jira|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracore/gdpr-changes-in-jira-975041009.html#GDPRchangesinJira-userkeys].

h3. Steps to replicate

# Create 2 *multi user picker* type fields. Let's call them:
## Multi User Picker Field 1 (field ID 10400)
## Multi User Picker Field 2 (field ID 10401)
# Create 3 Jira users. Let's call them:
## julien1
## julien2
## julien3
# Create an automation rule as follows:
#- WHEN: value changed for the "Summary" field
#- Then: Create a new issue.
#-- Inside this action, set the field "Multi User Picker Field 2" by using "Copy from trigger issue" and also "customfield_10400" (10400 being the ID of the field "Multi User Picker Field 1"
 !AutomationRule_Broken_Details.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new Jira issue in the project where the automation rule was created, as follows:
## Any summary of your choice
## "Multi User Picker Field 1" set to "julien1, julien3"
## "Multi User Picker Field 2" set to "julien2"
 !ExampleOfTicket.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the summary of this issue, in order to trigger the automation rule and create a new ticket

h3. Expected Results

A new ticket should be created, and the field "Multi User Picker Field 2" should contain all the 3 users "julien1, julien2, julien3", as shown below:
 !Expected_Results.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results

The automation rule fails to be executed (no new issue is created), and the following error is thrown in the Automation Audit logs:
{code}
Could not find usernames: JIRAUSER10100, JIRAUSER10500 (customfield_10401)
{code}

h3. Workaround

The workaround consists in changing the way we set the field in the rule action. Rather than using the auto-fill field, use the *Additional fields* option with the following operation involving smart values instead:
{code}
{
   "fields":{
      "customfield_10401" : [ { "name":"{{triggerIssue.customfield_10400.name}}" }, { "name":"{{triggerIssue.customfield_10401.name}}" }]
   }
}

{code}
 !AutomationRule_Fixed_Details.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Some automation rule fail to be executed when trying to combine multiple user picker fields into one

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When preparing a stage test environment with production data, we would like to have an option to temporarily disable all the rules, without the need to manually switch off each rule through the Gui Interface or disable the plugin.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Prepare a stage test environment using Production Data
 # Check the Automation rules list and go one by one, disabling each rule
 # Check the Service Desk Project Areas > Project Settings > Automation and disable each rule

h3. Expected Results
 * Have a single option that you could disable all the automation rules

h3. Actual Results
 * There is no option to disable all the rules. You need to go one by one

h3. Workaround
h4. Setting limits

Following the [Service limits|https://confluence.atlassian.com/automation/service-limits-993924705.html] knowledge base, temporarily set the property "max.processing.time.per.day" (default 3600) to a very small value, like "1", forcing all the automation rules to be throttled. The rule will start, but as the limit was reached, it will be interrupted.

You can run a curl command like the one below, replacing your user, password and jira base URL:
{code:java}
curl -X PUT -H 'Content-type: application/json' \
-u user:password \
-d '{"key": "max.processing.time.per.day", "value": "1"}' \
 http://jirabaseurl/rest/cb-automation/latest/configuration/property{code}
fields.summary: As a Jira admin, I would like to be able to temporarily stop all automation rules

It would be nice if we had the option to continue executing the rule if the web request's response is an error, or if we could provide additional instructions, components or actions to be executed if an automation rule receives such a response.

 # We will be using the rule displayed below as an example:  
!Screen Shot 2020-11-17 at 11.39.37.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Please add a new Jira automation trigger: _Issue resolved_, so that rules can be triggered upon resolution of an issue.

*Current workaround*

Currently the only workaround I could come up with is using Trigger: _Issue transitioned_ combined with Condition: _Issue matches JQL_: "resolution is not EMPTY". However this is inefficient because it triggers on every transition, rather than only when the issue is resolved (resulting in unnecessary executions). Reducing the scope of Trigger: _Issue transitioned_ by constraining listing all resolved type statuses in the To status field, is impractical and unmaintainable because in our instance we have many resolved type statuses and new ones get added all the time. It would be much simpler and useful if there was a trigger for _Issue resolved_
fields.summary: New trigger: Status category changed

fields.description:
Please add a new Jira automation trigger: _Issue resolved_, so that rules can be triggered upon resolution of an issue.

*Current workaround*

Currently the only workaround I could come up with is using Trigger: _Issue transitioned_ combined with Condition: _Issue matches JQL_: "resolution is not EMPTY". However this is inefficient because it triggers on every transition, rather than only when the issue is resolved (resulting in unnecessary executions). Reducing the scope of Trigger: _Issue transitioned_ by constraining listing all resolved type statuses in the To status field, is impractical and unmaintainable because in our instance we have many resolved type statuses and new ones get added all the time. It would be much simpler and useful if there was a trigger for _Issue resolved_
fields.summary: New trigger: Issue resolved

fields.description: When using Jira for Automation to copy a custom user picker field to another issue, if there are inactive users in the origin field, Jira for Automation fails to copy the field.
fields.summary: Better handling of inactive users on copy

fields.description:
Currently, whenever Automation for Jira searches for Insight objects, it returns a maximum of 25 objects (which is Insight's default value, according to its [API documentation|https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/#iql_objects_get]).

This could be problematic for instance's that contain several objects with similar names, as the relevant object may not be among the 25 listed results.

A possible solution would be searching for the *Object's key* instead, as they are unique identifiers.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create several (i.e. more than 25) insight objects with a similar name.
 # Use the *Edit issue* action to edit an Insight Object (single select or multi-select).
fields.summary: Ability to search for Insight Objects using their key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, whenever Automation for Jira searches for Insight objects, it returns a maximum of 25 objects (which is Insight's default value, according to its [API documentation|https://insight-javadoc.riada.io/insight-javadoc-8.6/insight-rest/#iql_objects_get]). 

This could be problematic for instance's that contain several objects with similar names, as the relevant object may not be among the 25 listed results.

Because of that, administrators should be able to configure the number of results returned by those searches.
  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create several (i.e. more than 25) insight objects with a similar name.
 # Use the *Edit issue* action to edit an Insight Object (single select or multi-select).
fields.summary: Ability to customize the number of Insight Objects returned

fields.description:
Problem Statement:

Label Manager addon provides Label type custom field. When customer add the label manager's Custom field in to the project and want to add the field in Automation rules.

These custom fields are not listed when "Create issue" action is chosen. Eventhough customers are using Smart Values to overcome this behaviour, they expect the field to be available in the drop down.

Expected Result:
 While automation rule is created, customer expecting "Label Manager" Custom field to be listed in "Choose field to set" dropdown.

Actual Result:
 The field is not available in the dropdown. 
 !Screenshot 2020-11-05 at 8.15.32 PM-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Support for Label manager's Custom field in set
